title: Toronto JS and Capital One present: A beginner's guide to Webpack and React
details:
Details
-------

Getting started with modern web application development can seem like a monumental challenge, and it's easy to spend weeks lost in a configuration and component nightmare. Even expert developers are left wandering around in the twisty passages of webpack without a clear roadmap, and the proper mental models for using React efficiently are not easy to come by.

Join us for an evening of enlightenment, with a pair of workshops designed to lift you out of the quagmire and set your feet on solid ground.

Webpack 2 with Rohan Nair

In this workshop we will learn the basics of setting up Webpack 2 for a React project for development and for deployment to production. We will cover Hot Module Reloading, bundles, and optimizing builds.  
Rohan is currently the Head of Engineering at Pungle Payments, a Fintech startup using React, Redux, Elixir and Docker. He wrote the Webpack React HMR guide, and often forgets that he did.

React State with Kalpana Arivazhagan

Introduction to Reactâ€™s state. Talk about the differences between Component state and Application State; know when and when not to use them.

Kalpana is a Full Stack Software Engineer interested in learning new technologies and building proof of concepts to keep herself up-to-date. For the past few years, she has been doing front-end development using AngularJs; most recently with React.
